item.title: [DERBY-2129] Tasks related to releasing 10.2.2
item.description: JIRA to track changes related to producing release 10.2.2.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Documentation: 10.2.1.6 documentation includes warnings that it "includes JDBC 4.0 functionality based on a pre-release of Java SE 6". That warning is defined by the jdbc4disclaimer conref in these files in the 10.2 doc branch:

adminguide/adminconrefs.dita
devguide/devconrefs.dita
ref/refconrefs.dita
tools/toolsconrefs.dita

It should be sufficient to set the text of the warning to blank.

Jean will do this task.
Attaching first draft of release notes for 10.2.2. Would appreciate early feedback on these release notes so that they are good to go when we generate the release candidate.

The section listing the changes/differences between 10.2.2.0 and 10.2.1.6 is missing. I find this information the key purpose of Release Notes. In the 10.2.1.6 release notes this information was included in the section prefaced with: "The following improvements distinguish 10.2.1.6 from 10.1.3.1:"

Only the first paragraph and the Bug list speak to release specific issue.

Thanks for looking at the Release Notes, Stan. As you note, 10.2.1.6 has a substantial section listing the new features which distinguish it from 10.1.3.1. There are no new features in 10.2.2. There are no changes to report other than what's mentioned in that first paragraph and the later bug list. Basically, 10.2.2 is just 10.2.1.6 plus a handful of bug fixes plus the compiled JDBC4 drivers. Do you think that I should add a paragraph emphasizing this?

I did not see the following issues in the 10.2.2 bug fixes list:
DERBY-1693
DERBY-1716
DERBY-1732
DERBY-2008
DERBY-2014

Also I think instead of:

10.2.2.0 functionality includes:

  • Embedded engine with JDBC drivers
  • Network Server
    ....

make it something like:

The Derby functionality includes:

  • Embedded engine with JDBC drivers
  • Network Server
    ...

(These features are already present in the previous version of Derby, so specifying 10.2.2 may be unnecessary)

Attaching version 2 of Release Notes, incorporating comments from Stan and Rajesh:

1) Added a sentence punching up the fact that this is not a feature release.

2) Added entries for the additional bug fixes mentioned by Rajesh.

3) Removed the misleading reference to 10.2.2.0 when introducing the Derby feature set.

Hi Rick -
In response to your question in the comment of 11/30.
The first sentence of the Release notes states that a list of differences is provided - this is how the document opens:
"These notes describe the difference between Derby release 10.2.2.0 and the preceding release"

My opinion is that, for consistency sake, we should have a standard Release Notes format (at least all Major sections should be the same for each Release Note produced) so adding back the 'changes/differences' section but annotating there (as you suggested) that "this is a maintence release no new features were added since 10.2.1.6" would be a good option. If not that then reword the first sentence so incorrect expectations are not set.

The reference guide still has this disclaimer about JDBC 4, should it be removed?

db-derby-10.2.2.0-bin/docs/html/ref/crefjdbc12657.html

Note that an application run on Java SE 6 uses the JDBC4 versions of Derby's JDBC drivers. In that environment, Derby's two JDBC drivers, the embedded driver and the network client driver, implement an early access (late beta) version of the JDBC4 specification. It is possible that the final version of the JDBC4 specification may differ from the early access version available when this manual was written. We expect such discrepancies to be minor. These discrepancies, if any, are documented in the 10.2 Release Notes.

Thanks for the catch, Dan. Removed that disclaimer, revision 485927.
Any discrepancies will still need to be documented in the release notes.
